jobs.title: Senior Analytics Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
London, Waterloo (Hybrid, 4 days in-office - Wednesday is our set work from home day, though you can come in on Wednesday too if you wish)

We are disrupting one of the world's largest asset classes, property. With £2Bn+ assets on our platform and 30,000+ users across 70 countries, we're building the future of asset ownership and in doing so, are able to address wealth inequality.

Our product simplifies property investing from start to finish, making real estate investment accessible to everyone.

What you'll love doing:

  • Working in cross-functional product teams, taking data initiatives from concept to deployment.

  • Navigating ambiguity in a fast-moving environment where ownership and freedom are core to how we operate.

  • Building data products and analytics infrastructure across the full stack. Working fluidly between SQL transformations and YAML configurations, using AI tools as your co-pilot throughout development.

  • Collaborating closely with product and design to ship high-quality analytics fast. Writing clear, maintainable SQL and dbt models for humans and AI models alike.

  • Helping to define analytics practices for an AI-first development culture. Mentoring other engineers as we scale our teams and impact.

    What you'll be doing:

  • Building a data platform that powers decision-making across GetGround, working as the second member of our data team alongside our Lead Data & Analytics Engineer.

  • Develop a deep understanding of the business to proactively uncover insights and influence strategy through data.

  • Co-governing our Count Metrics Catalog (semantic layer) and building trust in data across Product, Design, Growth, and RevOps teams.

  • Owning and evolving our dbt Warehouse layer, designing modular, testable, well-documented models that scale with our rapid growth.

  • Using the data your modelling to generate cross-business insights that inform decision-making at every level.

  • Supporting Mixpanel event instrumentation via Avo, ensuring our product analytics semantics are rock-solid.

  • Working with a modern stack (BigQuery, dbt-core/fusion, Dagster, Count, Mixpanel) and driving adoption of best practices.

  • Enabling self-serve analytics across the business - not just serving stakeholders, but empowering them.

What we're looking for:

  • 3-5+ years in analytics engineering, data engineering, or similar roles with production-grade analytics experience.

  • Fluency in SQL and comfort with git, dbt, and cloud-based warehouses (we use BigQuery).

  • Experience implementing CI pipelines, modular dbt practices, and working with event-level product analytics data.

  • Someone who cares deeply about code quality, reproducibility, and stakeholder trust.

  • A collaborative mindset, you'll mentor others, challenge assumptions, and ask "why?" frequently.

This role isn't for you if:

  • You want fully remote work. We're hybrid with 4 days in-office and believe passionately about the advantages of in-office collaboration and innovation.

  • You prefer being handed requirements rather than partnering with stakeholders to define analytics solutions.

  • You want to work in isolation. We see analytics as a collaborative function at the intersection of product, engineering, growth, and operations.

  • You're looking for a slow-paced corporate environment. We move fast, own outcomes, and live by our values: no BS, pursuit of excellence, feedback obsession, and healthy ego.

GetGround provides visa sponsorship for this role (if necessary)

Benefits:

  • 💰 Competitive salary

  • 💰 Stock options

  • 🏥 Private health & dental

  • 🏖 12 Mental health days off annually (1 per month) PLUS holidays + public holidays

  • 💚 Monthly wellness budget

  • 🫶 1 paid Community day off (paid day off to volunteer for a charitable cause)

  • 🏡 Hybrid working (check details with your recruiter)

  • 🥣 Free breakfast daily

  • 🎳 Team and company-wide events

  • 📈 360° performance reviews to promote a culture of growth and development

  • 🎤 Support for conferences and professional learning & development

What we are building: The first end-to-end real estate investment offering - making the dream of owning real estate more accessible to everyone globally.

Diversity & inclusion at GetGround: We encourage applications from all sections of society and we believe in the criticality of an inclusive culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by law.

  • 42% of our employees identify as female or non-specified, 58% as male

  • 22 nationalities represented across offices in 5 countries

  • Our work on Design Accessibility

  • Inclusion is at the heart of our culture - we celebrate and reflect on key D&I and cultural events such as: Black History Month, International Women's Day and Pride

For more information on how we store your candidate data, please see our recruitment privacy policy.

jobs.title: Graduate Product Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are disrupting one of the world's largest asset classes, property. With £2Bn+ assets on our platform and 30,000+ users across 70 countries, we're building the future of asset ownership and in doing so, are able to address wealth inequality.

Our product simplifies property investing from start to finish, making real estate investment accessible to everyone.

What you'll love doing:

  • Working in cross-functional product teams, taking ideas from concept to deployment.

  • Navigating ambiguity in a fast-moving environment where ownership and freedom are core to how we operate.

  • Building user-facing AI-native products across the full stack. You’ll gain exposure to React/TypeScript frontend and Golang backend, using AI tools as your co-pilot throughout development.

  • Collaborating closely with product and design to ship high-quality features fast. Writing clear, maintainable code for humans and AI models alike.

  • Learning from and contributing to engineering practices in an AI-first development culture.

What we're looking for:

  • A product mindset, with curiosity and a commercial focus to help build world class tech products.

  • Ideally you will have some exposure to fullstack development on consumer-facing products (through internships, projects, or coursework). It’s critical that you’re excited to learn and comfortable moving between frontend and backend.

  • You must be curious, have an experimentation mindset, and be excited to use AI tools (GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, code generation).

  • A collaborative mindset, with strong communication skills and an eagerness to share ideas and learn from others. We value technical rigour, clear communication, and questioning the status quo.

This role isn't for you if:

  • You want fully remote work. We're hybrid with 4 days in-office and believe passionately about the advantages of in-office collaboration and innovation.

  • You want to be handed technical requirements, rather than ambiguous problems to solve.

  • You prefer staying in your lane. We believe in fullstack engineers embracing AI-augmented workflows and contributing to the product roadmap.

  • You're looking for a slow-paced corporate environment. We move fast, own outcomes, and live by our values: no BS, pursuit of excellence, feedback obsession, and healthy ego.

We offer: Competitive salary, stock options, private health & dental, 12 mental health days annually, community volunteer day, free breakfast, learning & development support, and visa sponsorship.

What we are building: The first end-to-end real estate investment offering - making the dream of owning real estate more accessible to everyone globally.

Diversity & inclusion at GetGround: We encourage applications from all sections of society and we believe in the criticality of an inclusive culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by law.

  • 42% of our employees identify as female or non-specified, 58% as male

  • 22 nationalities represented across offices in 5 countries

  • Our work on Design Accessibility

  • Inclusion is at the heart of our culture - we celebrate and reflect on key D&I and cultural events such as: Black History Month, International Women's Day and Pride

For more information on how we store your candidate data, please see our recruitment privacy policy.

jobs.title: Lead Product Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are disrupting one of the world's largest asset classes, property. With £2Bn+ assets on our platform and 30,000+ users across 70 countries, we're building the future of asset ownership and in doing so, are able to address wealth inequality.

Our product simplifies property investing from start to finish, making real estate investment accessible to everyone.

What you'll love doing:

  • As a Lead Engineer you will help shape and define the roadmap of co-intelligent teams, enabling those around you to achieve impact in their roles through thought leadership and a delivery mindset.

  • Working in cross-functional product teams, taking ideas from concept to deployment.

  • Navigating ambiguity in a fast-moving environment where ownership and freedom are core to how we operate.

  • Building user-facing AI-native products across the full stack. Working fluidly between React/TypeScript frontend and Golang backend, using AI tools as your co-pilot throughout development.

  • Collaborating closely with product and design to ship high-quality features fast. Writing clear, maintainable code for humans and AI models alike.

  • Helping to define engineering practices for an AI-first development culture. Mentoring other engineers as we scale our team and impact.

What we're looking for:

  • Able to talk in depth about your ability to drive change, impact and excellence in those around you as well as your experience as a mentor and coach.

  • A product mindset, with a commercial focus to help build world class tech products.

  • Ideally you will have experience as a fullstack engineer on consumer-facing products. It’s critical you should be comfortable moving between frontend and backend regardless of your experience.

  • You must be curious and have an experimentation mindset and excited to use AI tools (GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, code generation).

  • A collaborative mindset with experience sharing your knowledge with other engineers. We value technical rigour, clear communication, and questioning the status quo.

This role isn't for you if:

  • You want fully remote work. We're hybrid with 4 days in-office and believe passionately about the advantages of in-office collaboration and innovation.

  • You want to be handed technical requirements, rather than ambiguous problems to solve.

  • You prefer staying in your lane. We believe in fullstack engineers embracing AI-augmented workflows contributing to product roadmap.

  • You're looking for a slow-paced corporate environment. We move fast, own outcomes, and live by our values: no BS, pursuit of excellence, feedback obsession, and healthy ego.

We offer: Competitive salary, stock options, private health & dental, 12 mental health days annually, community volunteer day, free breakfast, learning & development support, and visa sponsorship.

What we are building: The first end-to-end real estate investment offering - making the dream of owning real estate more accessible to everyone globally.

Diversity & inclusion at GetGround: We encourage applications from all sections of society and we believe in the criticality of an inclusive culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by law.

  • 42% of our employees identify as female or non-specified, 58% as male

  • 22 nationalities represented across offices in 5 countries

  • Our work on Design Accessibility

  • Inclusion is at the heart of our culture - we celebrate and reflect on key D&I and cultural events such as: Black History Month, International Women's Day and Pride

For more information on how we store your candidate data, please see our recruitment privacy policy.

jobs.title: Junior Accountant
jobs.descriptionHtml:
(Please note this role is with TPSSI, GetGround's partner. We work Monday to Friday, 11AM to 8PM local time in Makati City to support our partner GetGround in the UK)

TPSSI - who we are
Terranova Philippines Support Services Inc. (“TPSSI”) is a team of currently 30 colleagues (and growing!) that was formed to support our UK-based partner, GetGround. TPSSI operations are led by Mike (Makati) and Dan (UK). We are expanding the team of accountants significantly in the next 3 months.

👉 Here's some content from our Makati team (video, blog posts, podcasts): https://linktr.ee/getground_philippines

GetGround is a values-driven business with the purpose of making the world fairer and more productive by making investing in high value assets like real estate more accessible. GetGround has 30,000+ real estate customers globally with £1.5Bn+ real estate value in the platform.

Benefits - in additional to all Philippine mandatory benefits, we provide:

  • 💰 Competitive Salary

  • 🏥 HMO Benefits

  • 🏥 🦷 Health & Dental Insurance 

  • 🏖 12 Mental Health Days annually

  • 🏖 10 days SIL / Paid Time Off + Philippines Public Holidays

  • 📚 2 weeks of fully paid study leave for your growth and development

  • 🏡 1 day working from home per week (after passing your probation)

  • 🎳 Team and company-wide events

  • 📈 Learning budget to support your development

  • 🧠 Growth and Development Cycles with performance reviews to enable fast growth

What we’re looking for:

  • Degree in an accounting-related university course

  • <1 year of accounting-related work experience (fresh graduates welcome!)

  • Willing to work out of our Makati office, 4 days per week

What you will do:

  • Request financial information and documents from clients

  • Perform data entry and year-end closing transactions

  • Draft working papers

  • Submit reports to client and appropriate government authorities

  • Deliver world-class service with the support our your team

Please note - you might be called from a UK number on Viber! This will be a member of our Talent team

What we are building: The first end-to-end real estate investment offering - making the dream of owning real estate more accessible to everyone globally.

Diversity & inclusion at GetGround: We encourage applications from all sections of society and we believe in the criticality of an inclusive culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by law.

  • 42% of our employees identify as female or non-specified, 58% as male

  • 22 nationalities represented across offices in 5 countries

  • Our work on Design Accessibility

  • Inclusion is at the heart of our culture - we celebrate and reflect on key D&I and cultural events such as: Black History Month, International Women's Day and Pride

For more information on how we store your candidate data, please see our recruitment privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Product Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are disrupting one of the world's largest asset classes, property. With £2Bn+ assets on our platform and 30,000+ users across 70 countries, we're building the future of asset ownership and in doing so, are able to address wealth inequality.

Our product simplifies property investing from start to finish, making real estate investment accessible to everyone.

What you'll love doing:

  • Working in cross-functional product teams, taking ideas from concept to deployment.

  • Navigating ambiguity in a fast-moving environment where ownership and freedom are core to how we operate.

  • Building user-facing AI-native products across the full stack. Working fluidly between React/TypeScript frontend and Golang backend, using AI tools as your co-pilot throughout development.

  • Collaborating closely with product and design to ship high-quality features fast. Writing clear, maintainable code for humans and AI models alike.

  • Helping to define engineering practices for an AI-first development culture. Mentoring other engineers as we scale our team and impact.

What we're looking for:

  • A product mindset, with a commercial focus to help build world class tech products.

  • Ideally you will have experience as a fullstack engineer on consumer-facing products. It’s critical you should be comfortable moving between frontend and backend regardless of your experience.

  • You must be curious and have an experimentation mindset and excited to use AI tools (GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, code generation).

  • A collaborative mindset with experience sharing your knowledge with other engineers. We value technical rigour, clear communication, and questioning the status quo.

This role isn't for you if:

  • You want fully remote work. We're hybrid with 4 days in-office and believe passionately about the advantages of in-office collaboration and innovation.

  • You want to be handed technical requirements, rather than ambiguous problems to solve.

  • You prefer staying in your lane. We believe in fullstack engineers embracing AI-augmented workflows contributing to product roadmap.

  • You're looking for a slow-paced corporate environment. We move fast, own outcomes, and live by our values: no BS, pursuit of excellence, feedback obsession, and healthy ego.

We offer: Competitive salary, stock options, private health & dental, 12 mental health days annually, community volunteer day, free breakfast, learning & development support, and visa sponsorship.

  • 22 nationalities represented across offices in 5 countries

  • Our work on Design Accessibility

  • Inclusion is at the heart of our culture - we celebrate and reflect on key D&I and cultural events such as: Black History Month, International Women's Day and Pride

For more information on how we store your candidate data, please see our recruitment privacy policy.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
We are disrupting one of the world's largest asset classes, property. With £2Bn+ assets on our platform and 30,000+ users across 70 countries, we're building the future of asset ownership and in doing so, are able to address wealth inequality.

Our product simplifies property investing from start to finish, making real estate investment accessible to everyone.

What you'll love doing:

 - Working in cross-functional product teams, taking ideas from concept to deployment.

 - Navigating ambiguity in a fast-moving environment where ownership and freedom are core to how we operate.

 - Building user-facing AI-native products across the full stack. Working fluidly between React/TypeScript frontend and Golang backend, using AI tools as your co-pilot throughout development.

 - Collaborating closely with product and design to ship high-quality features fast. Writing clear, maintainable code for humans and AI models alike.

 - Helping to define engineering practices for an AI-first development culture. Mentoring other engineers as we scale our team and impact.

What we're looking for:

 - A product mindset, with a commercial focus to help build world class tech products.

 - Ideally you will have experience as a fullstack engineer on consumer-facing products. It’s critical you should be comfortable moving between frontend and backend regardless of your experience.

 - You must be curious and have an experimentation mindset and excited to use AI tools (GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, code generation).

 - A collaborative mindset with experience sharing your knowledge with other engineers. We value technical rigour, clear communication, and questioning the status quo.

This role isn't for you if:

 - You want fully remote work. We're hybrid with 4 days in-office and believe passionately about the advantages of in-office collaboration and innovation.

 - You want to be handed technical requirements, rather than ambiguous problems to solve.

 - You prefer staying in your lane. We believe in fullstack engineers embracing AI-augmented workflows contributing to product roadmap.

 - You're looking for a slow-paced corporate environment. We move fast, own outcomes, and live by our values: no BS, pursuit of excellence, feedback obsession, and healthy ego.

We offer: Competitive salary, stock options, private health & dental, 12 mental health days annually, community volunteer day, free breakfast, learning & development support, and visa sponsorship.

What we are building: The first end-to-end real estate investment offering - making the dream of owning real estate more accessible to everyone globally.

Diversity & inclusion at GetGround: We encourage applications from all sections of society and we believe in the criticality of an inclusive culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by law.

 - 42% of our employees identify as female or non-specified, 58% as male

 - 22 nationalities represented across offices in 5 countries

 - Our work on Design Accessibility https://medium.com/@GetGround/design-that-works-for-everyone-accessibility-at-getground-a7cf7ca867f0

 - Inclusion is at the heart of our culture - we celebrate and reflect on key D&I and cultural events such as: Black History Month, International Women's Day and Pride

For more information on how we store your candidate data, please see our recruitment privacy policy https://25516403.fs1.hubspotusercontent-eu1.net/hubfs/25516403/GetGroundRecruitmentPrivacyPolicy.pdf.

jobs.title: Accounting Supervisor
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We're a VC backed, disruptive technology business with a purpose to make the world fairer and more productive. We are doing this by making assets more transparent, trustworthy and accessible - starting with real estate. Incomes have stagnated and we believe by creating greater access to high value assets like real estate we believe we can be part of solving some of the wealth inequality. Our investment platform is focussed on one of the largest asset classes in the world - property. We are gaining significant momentum with our portfolio of products focused on the UK property investment market.

Our CEO and Founder Moubin previously worked at McKinsey and private equity firm APAX. Check out a podcast with Moubin speaking with our lead investors QED about how we're disrupting asset ownership.

Our four values are the foundation of our culture and shape our behaviours - no BS, pursuit of excellence, feedback obsession and healthy ego. We have built a high performing organisation where intrinsic drive fuels GetGrounders to build a world class investment experience for our users.

In numbers:

  • 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 85+ GetGrounders (ex Google, Meta, Deliveroo, Startups)

  • 🏘 £1.5Bn+ of assets being added onto our platform annually

  • 📈 30,000+ users across 70 countries, with ~10% market share

  • 🌎 Global hubs (UK, Dubai, Hong Kong, Singapore, Philippines)

(Please note this role is with TPSSI, GetGround's partner. We work Monday to Friday, 11AM to 8PM local time in Makati City to support our partner GetGround in the UK)

TPSSI - who we are
Terranova Philippines Support Services Inc. (“TPSSI”) is a team of currently 15 colleagues (and growing!) that was formed to support our UK-based partner, GetGround.
TPSSI operations are led by Mike (Makati) and Dan (UK) and you will work closely with both on a daily basis. We are expanding the team of accountants significantly in the next 3 months.

GetGround is a values-driven business with the purpose of making the world fairer and more productive by making investing in high value assets like real estate more accessible. GetGround has 30,000+ real estate customers globally with £1.5Bn+ real estate value in the platform 👉 Here's some content from our Makati team and global colleagues on our culture.

Benefits - in additional to all Philippine mandatory benefits, we provide:

  • 💰 Competitive Salary

  • 🏥 HMO Benefits

  • 🏥 🦷 Health & Dental Insurance 

  • 🏖 12 Mental Health Days annually

  • 🏖 10 days SIL / Paid Time Off + Philippines Public Holidays

  • 📚 2 weeks of fully paid study leave for your growth and development

  • 🏡 1 day working from home per week (after passing your probation)

  • 🎳 Team and company-wide events

  • 📈 Learning budget to support your development

  • 🧠 Growth and Development Cycles with performance reviews to enable fast growth

What we’re looking for:

  • Accounting degree

  • 4+ years of accounting-related work experience

  • 2+ years of team management experience

  • Experience in preparing and reviewing financial and tax reports

  • Willing to work out of our Makati office, 4 days per week 

NOT essential, but nice to have:

  • Knowledge of the UK accounting standards  

  • CPA  

What you will do 

  • Lead a team of Junior and Senior Accounting Associates, providing coaching and mentorship

  • Client account management

  • Provide guidance to your team in the preparation and submission of year-end accounts

  • Review and approve client financial reports

  • Identify and propose process or system improvements to increase effectiveness and efficiency 

  • Deliver world-class client service with the support of the Operations Accounting Manager

What we are building: The first end-to-end real estate investment offering - making the dream of owning real estate more accessible to everyone globally.

Diversity & inclusion at GetGround: We encourage applications from all sections of society and we believe in the criticality of an inclusive culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by law.

  • 42% of our employees identify as female or non-specified, 58% as male

  • 22 nationalities represented across offices in 5 countries

  • Our work on Design Accessibility

  • Inclusion is at the heart of our culture - we celebrate and reflect on key D&I and cultural events such as: Black History Month, International Women's Day and Pride

For more information on how we store your candidate data, please see our recruitment privacy policy.
